Posts.Title: February Chemo Cruisers Heading to Rads ErinsGram wildabouthorses
February Chemo Cruisers Heading to Rads ErinsGram wildabouthorses

Posts.Content: Jul 18, 2007 10:13AM ErinsGram wrote: Hillary - yes, they gave me silvadine(sp?). Today she also told me to mix equal amounts of peroxide and water and apply to the raw skin with a cotton ball - I suspect to help it dry out - and then when it's completely dry to apply the cream. I asked her today if this blistering was normal and she said 'Yep!' but when it gets to that point, they need to make a decision to continue or discontinue use of the bolus. They did not use it today and will not use it for my final zap tomorrow. My rad onc is thinking he won't start the boost Friday but instead wait till Monday to give the skin a 3-day break because they do use the bolus with the boosts.
Posts.Title: February Chemo Cruisers Heading to Rads ErinsGram wildabouthorses

Posts.Content: ErinsGram wrote: Looks like I may be kicking off the 'spotlight' group. Not sure when I'll be in the real limelight, but my simulation is May 29. Background - >5 CM ILC w/1 node of 26. LM January 16th, started DD A/C Feb 12, DD Taxol April 9, last Taxol May 21. Rads to be followed by Femara, prophy RM and reconstruction (to be determined). Phyl Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: February Chemo Cruisers Heading to Rads ErinsGram wildabouthorses

Posts.Content: Jul 25, 2007 07:05AM ErinsGram wrote: Marsha - I hope your blisters don't open up. That's why my area is so big - I keep adding smaller blisters around the original one and as the skin peels off the top, they all run together into 1 BIG one. (I was gonna send you a picture but didn't want to gross you out!) 2 more days to go!

Posts.Content: Jul 8, 2007 05:30AM ErinsGram wrote: Hillary - I was not aware of this either. I have 9 to go, I think, and I believe 3 of those are boosts. I see my onc or his PA every Thursday so I reckon I'll know more this week since next Thursday should be the end.
